item.title: Greg Wilson:: The Third Bit: Afraid of Change
item.description: Discovered: Dec 4, 2024 07:19 Greg Wilson:: The Third Bit: Afraid of Change <‚Äì QUOTE: I think thought leaders in Silicon Valley started recommending it to each other for two reasons. First, it allows them to blame subordinates for not speaking out (again, ignoring the experience some of those subordinates may have had of bosses who say ‚ÄúI want to hear what you think‚Äù but really don‚Äôt). Second, it satisfies tech bros‚Äô need to talk about something other than sexual harassment, racial discrimination, and pay inequity‚Äîin other words, their need to talk about things that sound important but won‚Äôt make them uncomfortable or undermine the system that they hope will make them rich.

item.title: Nic Morales:: Cost of Convenience, a Wireless Shifting Review - BIKEPACKING.com
item.description: Discovered: Dec 4, 2024 07:15 Nic Morales:: Cost of Convenience, a Wireless Shifting Review - BIKEPACKING.com <‚Äì can we invent electronic shifting that doesn‚Äôt require lithium batteries and complicated and bug prone proprietary software? I think so but there‚Äôs no will :-) ‚Äì> QUOTE: I can‚Äôt answer all those questions. And living in a world that has normalized such energy usage is complex. I‚Äôm typing this on a computer powered by lithium batteries while sitting next to a phone powered by lithium batteries and being kept cool by a window unit A/C powered by electricity. But if we have to qualify and exonerate every potential criticism of new technologies through the sometimes unavoidable missteps of our current circumstance, we‚Äôll never make anything better. I‚Äôm not proposing an unimpeachable solution to the moral and material ailments of our society‚ÄîI‚Äôm 29 years old, I don‚Äôt know anything. I‚Äôm questioning the unnecessary complication of an activity that has meaningfully improved my life through the inherently revolutionary nature of its existence.

item.title: Dead Internet Souls | ‚òÖ‚ù§‚ú∞ Vicki Boykis ‚òÖ‚ù§‚ú∞
item.description: Discovered: Dec 3, 2024 07:36 Dead Internet Souls | ‚òÖ‚ù§‚ú∞ Vicki Boykis ‚òÖ‚ù§‚ú∞ <‚Äì AMEN! Read the whole thing! ‚Äì> QUOTE: If you are a human out there in the vast wilds of the new internet of dead souls, speak up. We are still out there, on the small web, being ingested into indie search engine indexes, on blogs, on websites. ... The machines are thinking, but so are people, and they‚Äôre still much better. I‚Äôm still out here. Come be out here with me, too.

item.title: Jason Velaquez:: Bluesky may have the juice, but we don't have to drink the Kool-Aid
item.description: Discovered: Dec 3, 2024 07:31 Jason Velaquez:: Bluesky may have the juice, but we don‚Äôt have to drink the Kool-Aid <‚Äì QUOTE: Communities cultivate. Markets extract. Cultivators make decisions based on what is best for the community. Extractors make the number go up. Communities can have markets, of course. But when markets run the community, we end up with the Internet we have today. Markets had their shot and they füá∫cked it up. It's time we brought back the virtual community. <‚Äì Amen! Read the whole thing :-)

item.title: Fred's ImageMagick Scripts: SHUFFLE Randomly shuffles positions of square sized tiles in an image.
item.description: Discovered: Dec 1, 2024 06:38 Fred‚Äôs ImageMagick Scripts: SHUFFLE Randomly shuffles positions of square sized tiles in an image. <‚Äì I‚Äôve written Ruby code to do this in the past, oops. But then again maybe this doesn‚Äôt work in imagemagick version 7?!? Awesome if it did!

item.title: c - How to add spacing between characters in text using VIPS? - Stack Overflow
item.description: Discovered: Nov 30, 2024 20:32 c - How to add spacing between characters in text using VIPS? - Stack Overflow <‚Äì colour output is now supported ‚Äì> vips text x.png '<span letter_spacing="10000">Hello!</span>' --dpi 300

item.title: Collapsible Sections work in jekyll github.com blogs and github pages but you need a markdown="1" attribute in the details tag and markdown="span" in the summary tag
item.description:
Collapsible markdown works

  • You need a markdown="1" attribute in the details tag and markdown="span" in the summary tag
  • Hat tip to the folks who found this in github.com issue: Update docs for ‚ÄúOrganizing information with collapsed sections‚Äù to include GitHub Pages support #32988
Click me

yes, even collapsed code blocks work

print("hello world!")

Full code from issue 32988

<details markdown="1">

<summary markdown="span">Tips for collapsed sections</summary>

### You can add a header

You can add text within a collapsed section. 

You can add an image or a code block, too.

```ruby
   puts "Hello World"
\`\`\` <-- unescape the backslashes for your actual blog post!

</details>

Previously

  • November 26, 2018: HTML tags and can be used for expand/collapse with disclosure triangles for ‚Äòcollapsible HTML‚Äô

item.title: Bodensee / Lake Constance circumnavigation / ride around the lake Strava routes & GPX files for anybody riding around the Bodensee in the future! Do not follow, for planning only! To help make up for the lack of GPX files from Radweg Reisen and my lack of map / wayfinding skills
item.description:
• As seen on Mastodon :-) at devdilettante.com/@roland/113334906051980251
  • 1. Bodensee Bummel Day 1 route: Bodensee Bummel: Hotel Ko‚Äôono, Konstanz -> Gailingen am Hochrein (Day 1 GPX file in Google Drive) <‚Äì www.strava.com/routes/3282752547101555878 Please don‚Äôt follow this route :-) because we ended up on the road too much because we didn‚Äôt have a GPX file in advance like this. Instead, use it to plan yours :-) And hopefully someday somebody will do a proper route that avoids traffic as much as possible (I bet somebody else has already done so and I hope Radweg Reisen provides the GPX files to future customers which I see other bicycle tour companies e.g. UTracks provides a Digital information pack with route notes & GPX for their Spanish Camino bicycle tour ). And yes I should learn how to use paper maps (but I bet i am not the only one who would pay extra for GPX files on bicycle tours) and not rely on digital whinge whinge, deskilling etc etc :-)
  • 2. Bodensee Bummel Day 2 route: Bodensee Bummel: Gailingen am Hochrein -> √úberlingen <‚Äì strava.com/routes/3282759657221707238 (Day 2 GPX file): Please don‚Äôt follow this route :-) because we ended up on the road too much because we didn‚Äôt have a GPX file in advance like this. Instead, use it to plan yours :-)
  • 3. Day 3
    • 3.1 Bodensee Bummel: Day 3 Part 1 Bodensee Bummel: √úberlingen -> Fishbach, Friedrichshafen strava.com/routes/3282833367325959334 (Day 3 Part 1 GPX file) Please don‚Äôt follow this route :-) etc etc :-)
    • 3.2 Bodensee Bummel: Day 3 Part 2 Bodensee Bummel: Day 3 Part 2: Fishbach, Friedrichshafen -> Kressbronn (Day 3 Part 2 GPX file): Please don‚Äôt follow this route :-) etc etc :-) www.strava.com/routes/3282834608474893990
  • 4. Bodensee Bummel: Day 4: Bodensee Bummel: Kressbronn -> H√∂chst, Austria (Day 4 GPX file): Please don‚Äôt follow this route :-) etc etc :-) strava.com/routes/3282835839360900774
  • 5. Bodensee Bummel: Day 5: H√∂chst, Austria -> Hotel Ko‚ÄôOno Litzelstetten, Konstanz, Germany (Day 5 GPX file): strava.com/routes/3282836840272815270) Please don‚Äôt follow this route :-) etc etc :-)

Previously

  • October 14, 2024: Bodensee Bicycle Ride with Radweg Reisen tours: Fabulous except for bad wayfinding

Previously

  • October 14, 2023: Got my 5th vaccination today: Moderna bivalent booster for 2023 plus the 2023 flu vaccine, go science go! #VaccinateThePlanet

item.title: Extract Month and Year from timestamp in BigQuery using SQL EXTRACT, YEAR, MONTH, CONCAT, CAST, LPAD
item.description:
Discovered: Aug 8, 2024 00:29 Extract Month and Year from timestamp in Bigquery - Stack Overflow <‚Äì QUOTE: Answering the title of the question as probably others will end up here like me looking for a way to create a YYYYMM year-month from a BigQuery timestamp. ... This is the code I ended up with in standard SQL:

CONCAT(\
CAST(EXTRACT(YEAR from timestamp) as string), \
LPAD(CAST(EXTRACT(MONTH from timestamp) asstring),2,'0')) \
AS yearmonth

^^‚Äì I‚Äôll probably need this Eines Tages!

Previously

  • May 25, 2020: HowTo: SQLite SQL query to get all May 1-25, 2020 Firefox desktop en-us questions that contain sync in title, content or tags columns
